text:
This relates to
   http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27078
which discusses the classpath inclusion of those libs that
used to be in optional.jar.

The error message for 1.6.1 when you try to run, say, junit,
is not sufficiently informative to make one aware that the bug
above applies. I would request that you alter the passage:
 - The task is an Ant optional task and optional.jar is absent
   Fix: look for optional.jar in ANT_HOME/lib, download if needed
to describe the current situation

Here is the complete text of my interaction that shows the problem
(I believe this demonstrates that the problem is with the 1.6.1
error message, not with my build.xml). I agree that this is not an
Ant bug, but it is a documentation bug.

[home]29: ant test
Buildfile: build.xml

test:

BUILD FAILED
/home/rgf/setenv/EDEN-IW/cvs/EDEN-IW/build.xml:141: Could not create task or
type of type: junit.

Ant could not find the task or a class this task relies upon.

This is common and has a number of causes; the usual 
solutions are to read the manual pages then download and
install needed JAR files, or fix the build file: 
 - You have misspelt 'junit'.
   Fix: check your spelling.
 - The task needs an external JAR file to execute
   and this is not found at the right place in the classpath.
   Fix: check the documentation for dependencies.
   Fix: declare the task.
 - The task is an Ant optional task and optional.jar is absent
   Fix: look for optional.jar in ANT_HOME/lib, download if needed
 - The task was not built into optional.jar as dependent
   libraries were not found at build time.
   Fix: look in the JAR to verify, then rebuild with the needed
   libraries, or download a release version from apache.org
 - The build file was written for a later version of Ant
   Fix: upgrade to at least the latest release version of Ant
 - The task is not an Ant core or optional task 
   and needs to be declared using <taskdef>.

Remember that for JAR files to be visible to Ant tasks implemented
in ANT_HOME/lib, the files must be in the same directory or on the
classpath

Please neither file bug reports on this problem, nor email the
Ant mailing lists, until all of these causes have been explored,
as this is not an Ant bug.
creator: gfowler@acm.org
